description.narrative: English Language Classes in Information Redacted in FY21 Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: Civic Participation in NATO Membership Debate

description.narrative: Civic Participation in NATO Membership Debate: Membership in NATO and the European Union are the Government of Montenegro's (GOM) leading foreign policy goals, and supporting these efforts is an important objective for the U.S. Government. While the GOM is undertaking the reforms necessary for membership, the public is ill-informed on the issue. These funds will support a healthy, open, and well informed debate in the public sphere on what NATO is, what the requirements and responsibilities of membership are, and what the benefits for Montenegro would be.

Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. title.narrative: Civic Participation in NATO Membership Debate

description.narrative: Civic Participation in NATO Membership Debate: Membership in NATO and the European Union are the Government of Montenegro's (GOM) leading foreign policy goals, and supporting these efforts is an important objective for the U.S. Government. While the GOM is undertaking the reforms necessary for membership, the public is ill-informed on the issue. These funds will support a healthy, open, and well informed debate in the public sphere on what NATO is, what the requirements and responsibilities of membership are, and what the benefits for Montenegro would be.

title.narrative: INL English language classes in Information Redacted Feb J

description.narrative: INL English language classes in Information Redacted Feb Jul 2019 Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: Civic Participation in NATO Membership Debate

description.narrative: Civic Participation in NATO Membership Debate: This funding will support a healthy, open, and well informed debate in the public sphere on what NATO is, what the requirements and responsibilities of membership are, and what the benefits for Montenegro would be. Membership in NATO and the European Union are the Government of Montenegros (GOM) leading foreign policy goals, and supporting these efforts is an important objective for the U.S. government. While the GOM is undertaking the reforms necessary for membership, the public is ill-informed on the issue.
